definitions.text: an area in hostile territory that has been captured and is held awaiting further troops and supplies
examples: an attempt to secure a bridgehead behind enemy lines
the only foothold left for British troops in Europe was Gibraltar

definitions.text: a place providing support for the foot in standing or climbing
an initial accomplishment that opens the way for further developments
examples: the town became a beachhead in the campaign to ban smoking outdoors
they are presently attempting to gain a foothold in the Russian market
